title: Return Transaction Record Value
description: Schema for a return transaction record, including return ID, receipt ID, transaction date, and a list of returned items.

id.description: Unique identifier for the return transaction.

return_id.description: Identifier for the return associated with the transaction.

receipt_id.description: Identifier of the original receipt linked to the return.

transaction_date.description: Timestamp of when the return transaction occurred, in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

customer_id.description: Unique identifier for the customer making the return.

_attachments.description: A link to the documents attachments (e.g., media, binary data) if any exist. In most cases, it will just be an empty string unless you actually upload attachments.

_etag.description: The entity tag for optimistic concurrency control. It changes every time the document is updated. Cosmos DB uses it to check if the document has changed since a client last read it.

_lsn.description: Logical Sequence Number. It represents the order in which operations (insert/update/delete) were performed. Used internally for replication and change feed processing.

_rid.description: The resource ID of the document â€” a unique, internal identifier that Cosmos DB uses to find the document quickly inside its physical storage

_self.description: A URI path to the document within the Cosmos DB REST API. You can use it to directly operate (read/update/delete) on the document via the API.

_ts.description: The timestamp (in UNIX epoch seconds) of when the document was last modified

items.description: List of returned items in the transaction.

sku_id.description: SKU identifier for the returned item.

unit_price.description: Price per unit of the returned item.
